intro: Stenia bohnkiana, commonly known as the Bohnkian stenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Stenia bohnkiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
